body: Please open an issue in `Next.js` repo.

This looks like a bug. Do you have a stack trace for this error?

Is it reproducible without next.js?

The error suddenly manifested when I upgraded Webpack from `5.0.0-beta.28` to `5.0.0-rc.3` so I assumed it was a Webpack issue. ðŸ™‚ 

Full stack trace:
```
Error occurred prerendering page "/". Read more: https://err.sh/next.js/prerender-error
TypeError: undefined is not a function
    at PricingTable (/Users/michiel/Documents/monitr/repos/monitr.be/.next/server/pages/index.js:2983:32)
    at d (/Users/michiel/Documents/monitr/repos/monitr.be/node_modules/react-dom/cjs/react-dom-server.node.production.min.js:36:498)
    at $a (/Users/michiel/Documents/monitr/repos/monitr.be/node_modules/react-dom/cjs/react-dom-server.node.production.min.js:39:16)
    at a.b.render (/Users/michiel/Documents/monitr/repos/monitr.be/node_modules/react-dom/cjs/react-dom-server.node.production.min.js:44:476)
    at a.b.read (/Users/michiel/Documents/monitr/repos/monitr.be/node_modules/react-dom/cjs/react-dom-server.node.production.min.js:44:18)
    at renderToString (/Users/michiel/Documents/monitr/repos/monitr.be/node_modules/react-dom/cjs/react-dom-server.node.production.min.js:54:364)
    at renderPage (/Users/michiel/Documents/monitr/repos/monitr.be/node_modules/next/dist/next-server/server/render.js:50:851)
    at Object.ctx.renderPage (/Users/michiel/Documents/monitr/repos/monitr.be/.next/server/pages/_document.js:675:28)
    at Function.getInitialProps (/Users/michiel/Documents/monitr/repos/monitr.be/.next/server/pages/_document.js:153:19)
    at Function.getInitialProps (/Users/michiel/Documents/monitr/repos/monitr.be/.next/server/pages/_document.js:679:83)
```

I haven't been able to create a repro without Next.js though.
@MichielDeMey If you create reproducible test repo with next I can point to bug line

I've create a minimal repo here: https://github.com/MichielDeMey/nextjs-webpack5

Uses Next.js `9.5.4-canary.23`, which has been updated to fix a change in the configuration schema introduced in Webpack `^5.0.0-beta.30`. Webpack version used is `^5.0.0-rc.3`.

Everything works when running a dev server (`yarn dev`) but fails when trying to create a production build using `yarn build`.

Main issue can be found when trying to import the JSON file: https://github.com/MichielDeMey/nextjs-webpack5/blob/master/pages/index.tsx#L1

issue.title: don't touch not provided exports as they could be on the prototype

repository.name: webpack
repository.description: A bundler for javascript and friends. Packs many modules into a few bundled assets. Code Splitting allows for loading parts of the application on demand. Through "loaders", modules can be CommonJs, AMD, ES6 modules, CSS, Images, JSON, Coffeescript, LESS, ... and your custom stuff.

issue.title: Webpack 5.0.0-beta.31 broke operations on arrays imported from JSON files

repository.name: webpack
repository.description: A bundler for javascript and friends. Packs many modules into a few bundled assets. Code Splitting allows for loading parts of the application on demand. Through "loaders", modules can be CommonJs, AMD, ES6 modules, CSS, Images, JSON, Coffeescript, LESS, ... and your custom stuff.

issue.body:
<!-- Please don't delete this template because we'll close your issue -->
<!-- Before creating an issue please make sure you are using the latest version of webpack. -->

# Bug report

I have the following code in my project (simplified):

```js
import types from '../../../../../../config/types.json';

function getLabel(data) {
  return types.find(
    el => el.type === data.type,
  ).label;
}

function validate({
  response,
  data,
}) {
  const { type } = response;

  if (type !== formData.type) {
    console.warn(`Type mismatch: '${formData.type}' provided, expected '${type}'.`);

    const typeLabel = getLabel(data);

    return `It looks like ${typeLabel} type is wrong.`;
  }
}
```

where imported `types.json` is something like

```
[
  {
    "label": "Label",
    "type": 1
  }
  {
    "label": "Another label",
    "type": 2
  }
]
```

and obviously, `validate()` function is ran at some point.

After upgrading from Webpack `5.0.0-beta.29` to `5.0.0-rc.3`, I've noticed that this function started crashing.

I investigated by updating it step by step and here's my outcome:

| Version | Works? |
| -- | -- |
| 5.0.0-beta.29 | Yes âœ…  |
| 5.0.0-beta.30 | Yes âœ…  |
| 5.0.0-beta.31 | No âŒ  |
| 5.0.0-rc.0 | No âŒ  |
| 5.0.0-rc.3 | No âŒ  |

**What is the current behavior?**

In `5.0.0-beta.31`, `5.0.0-rc.0`, `5.0.0-rc.3` it's compiled to (whitespace added for readability):

```js
if(o!==s.type)
  return console.warn("Type mismatch: '"+s.type+"' provided, expected '"+o+"'."), 
  "It looks like "+function(e){return(void 0)((function(t){return t.type===e.type})).label}(s)+" type is wrong.";
```

which causes the following error:

```
TypeError: (void 0) is not a function
```

**What is the expected behavior?**

In `5.0.0-beta.29`, `5.0.0-beta.30`, `if` statement is compiled to (whitespace added for readability):

```js
if(o!==s.type)
  return console.warn("Type mismatch: '"+s.type+"' provided, expected '"+o+"'."), 
  "It looks like "+function(e){return _.find((function(t){return t.type===e.type})).label}(s)+" type is wrong.";
```

which correctly prints

```
Type mismatch: <type> provided, expected <expectedType>.
```

and correctly returns

```
It looks like <type.label> type is wrong.
```

**Other relevant information:**

Changing types.json from to `js` (`export default [{â€¦}, {â€¦}]`) makes it all working again.

Similarly, changing the code slightly not to do direct operations on array imported from JSON:

```diff
-import rawTypes from '../../../../../../config/types.json';
+import rawTypes from '../../../../../../config/types.json';
+
+const types = [...rawTypes];

function getLabel(data) {
  const { label } = types.find(
    el => el.type === data.type,
  );

  return label;
}
```

also fixes the issue.

So my diagnosis is: tree-shaking / or minifying / or module concatenating functionality, starting with 5.0.0-beta.31, stopped correctly recognizing Array.find on arrays imported from JSON files, causing them be "resolved" to `void 0`, and consequently, to no longer work.

webpack version: 5.0.0-rc.3
Node.js version: 14.5.0
Operating System: macOS Big Sur

body:
As noted in https://github.com/webpack/webpack/issues/11588, it doesn't seem to be Next.js specific (I'm using pure Webpack). 

The version in which mapping over arrays imported from JSONs seem to have been broken is 5.0.0-beta.31.
@wojtekmaj It is not Next.js specific, it is bug in webpack and we are working on fix
